experience: You and Jeanne both know Steve McVey, Tim Bangert, and 13 others

I review the work reports that are prepared by our examiners. I check for accuracy in the written and typed reports before they are sent to the Client. I answer Client inquiries on various title questions. I work with the county websites to provide additional information that may have been unclear or overlooked on searches.I attempt to be the LINK between office staff and search staff, helping both groups understand each others needs so that we can run more efficiently. Having been an examiner, I understand search issues, and now being in the office, I can better understand the work flow from typist point of view.

More of the same as with R.A.M. I had to learn their forms(went from 1 page summary sheet to 3 or more pages with each report). I stayed mainly in Franklin County doing full searches and Commercial searching. For RAM I traveled daily to 3 or more counties and am familiar with 20+ counties and several different indexing systems.

I was taught to perform Real Estate title searches at the county level. Understanding the functions of the various county offices and what information is needed from each of the offices helps to make the searching process easier regardless what county you are in.
